page.title: 01The Vicar of Fordham
page.content: The present{Vicar}of{Fordham} is {Mr. Jim Rone}who has been{Vicar}for two and a half years. He is also the {Rector}of{Kennet}and has duties in{Ely {Cathedral}once a month. Before coming to{Fordham}he was in a village near {Milton Keynes}called{Stony Stratford and before that he was at{Calvaton}and also at{Oxford.}He was born in {Growcorn}in{Cheshire}in the late {1930's.}His{wife}helps him on visits and is{secretary}of the{Church {Council.}Before that she was the {Bishop of Oxford's secretary}and she is now the{Bishop of Ely's secretary which she has been since{1971.}Before {Mr. Jim Rone}became a{Priest}he was an {acountant}for{18 years.}He then became a{Priest}at the{age of 40 after 5 {years}he was{ordained Vicar of {Fordham.}
